name: wood chipping, industrial residual wood, stationary electric chipper | wood chipping, industrial residual wood, stationary electric chipper | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/4003/documentation

This data represents the service of wood chopping to output one kg of dry mass wood chips. ;The dataset represents the use of a chopper in sawmill. The data is provided by a Swiss company, which is assumed representative for central Europe. The dataset describes a sawmill with an annual output of 5'000 m3; compared to sizes of plants elsewhere, this is a very small plant. Several types of choppers exist. ;Here only one model is developed and the uncertainty, especially for energy consumption, is rather high.

Wood chopping process starting from industrial residual wood (sidings and squarings) at sawmill site.

This activity ends with wood chips wood at sawmill site, The dataset includes chopping of industrial residual wood in stationary electric chopper. The dataset does not include direct wood dust emissions to the air from the chopper.
category: C:Manufacturing/16:Manufacture of wood and of products of wood and cork, except furniture; manufacture of articles of straw and plaiting materials/161:Sawmilling and planing of wood/1610:Sawmilling and planing of wood

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Data for Switzerland used for central Europe
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: The dataset represents the use of a stationary electric chopper. The chopper is powered by a motor of 37 kW; additionally a 5 kW-motor is used for the feeding of the wood. Its service life is around 30'000 service hours or 100'000 piled m3.;Reference:;Etienne (1993) Personal communication. Etienne AG, Luzern. (a private company)

exchanges.description: Reference product. The production of one kg of wood chips by use of a stationary wood chopper. The reference product refers to the chopping process itself, and not the input of wood. The wood chopper runs on electricity and is integrated at the sawmill. Several types of choppers exist but this dataset is developed for only one model produced in Switzerland.  The wood chips produced may be from residual wood and/or industrial wood in the forest and subsequently used as biomass fuel.
